title: Already Pardoned by Trump, Jan. 6 Rioters Push for Compensation
summary: One of the rioters’ lawyers wants to create a panel that would decide on financial damages for what the rioters believe were unfair prosecutions.

title: In Trump’s Federal Work Force Cuts, Black Women Are Among the Hardest Hit
summary: President Trump has cut hundreds of thousands of jobs from the federal work force, disproportionately affecting Black employees.

title: Historians See Autocratic Playbook in Trump’s Attacks on Science
summary: Authoritarians have long feared and suppressed science as a rival for social influence. Experts see President Trump as borrowing some of their tactics.

title: Rudy Giuliani Is Hurt in Car Crash in New Hampshire
summary: Mr. Giuliani, the former New York City mayor and lawyer for President Trump, suffered a fractured vertebra, his head of security said.

title: U.S. Suspends Visas for Palestinian Passport Holders, Officials Say
summary: The move will stop, at least temporarily, travel for medical treatment, attending university, visiting relatives or conducting business.

title: Houthis Vow Revenge After Israeli Attack Kills Senior Officials
summary: Israel’s assassination of top officials last week is likely to make the Iranian-backed militia even more hawkish, Yemen analysts say.

title: Israel Says It Killed Abu Obeida, Spokesman for Hamas’s Armed Wing
summary: Hamas did not immediately comment on the Israeli military’s claim that Abu Obeida, one of the armed group’s best-known officials in the Arab world, had been killed.

title: Trump Crime Strategy May Work for Now, but Not for Long, Experts Say
summary: The president is looking to add troops to city streets while cutting funds for programs that work, experts and local officials say. But one idea, beautifying neighborhoods, has buy-in.

title: Chicago’s Mayor Rejects Trump’s Plans to Send Troops to His City
summary: Mayor Brandon Johnson of Chicago ordered local police officers not to aid the federal crackdown, ramping up the tensions between the White House and state and local officials.

title: How Trump Administration Cuts Are Hurting National Parks
summary: Amid deep cuts, more than 90 parks have reported problems like lost revenue and cuts to emergency services. One expert called this “a dangerous path.”

title: Brazil Tightens Bolsonaro House Arrest Amid Escape Concerns
summary: Former President Jair Bolsonaro, who will stand trial on Tuesday, is being closely monitored by the Brazilian authorities, who fear he may try to flee.

title: In the Hills of Puerto Rico, Feasting on a Very Smelly Fruit
summary: Every summer, superfans of durian converge on a remote farm in western Puerto Rico to devour one of the world’s most polarizing fruits.

title: The Manhattan Park That Keeps Children Locked Out
summary: A beloved park on state-owned land in Upper Manhattan has been closed for years, with neither the government nor any nonprofit groups willing to step in to operate it.

title: The Corporate Logo That Broke the Internet
summary: How to bend political reality in two easy steps.

title: Disney World Is the Happiest Place on Earth, if You Can Afford It
summary: The theme-park operator, like so many other companies, is abandoning America’s middle class.

title: Man Found Dead at Burning Man, Prompting Homicide Investigation
summary: The victim, whose identity was unknown, was found “lying in a pool of blood” on Saturday night, officials said.

title: Northern Lights Could Put on a Show for Large Sections of U.S.
summary: A dazzling display in the nighttime sky might be seen much farther south than usual, including parts of Iowa, Oregon and Pennsylvania, by Tuesday, forecasters said.

title: Rikers Detainee Becomes Third Person to Die in N.Y.C. Custody in a Week
summary: Days before the death of the man, Jimmy Avila, another detainee was pronounced dead in his cell at the troubled city jail complex, and a third died in police custody.

title: How Builder.ai Collapsed Amid Silicon Valley’s Biggest Boom
summary: Builder.ai went from a value of $1.5 billion to zero in a few months, amid questions over the sales of an A.I. product. Its downfall hints at a broader downturn.
